Theory of "principal enemy" flailed 
    Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- U Tae Sik, spokesman for the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils, reportedly issued a commentary on July 7 titled "we criticize the anti-north Cold War theory of the ministry of national defence which called the north 'principal enemy.'"
 Recalling that the ministry in teaching materials called "moral education" termed the DPRK a "principal enemy" and similar remarks are made by brass hats in an unbroken chain, the commentary said that their Cold War idea runs counter to the spirit of the June 15 Joint Declaration.    
 Dismissing the recent act of the ministry as one toeing the U.S. line, the commentary urged the military authorities to immediately withdraw the label of "principal enemy" attached to the north.
